t: Job 28
Surely*p there is a vein for the silver, and a place for gold where they fine it.
Iron*p is taken out of the earth, and brass is molten out of the stone.
He*p setteth an end to darkness, and searcheth out all perfection: the stones of darkness, and the shadow of death.
The*p flood breaketh out from the inhabitant; even the waters forgotten of the foot: they are dried up, they are gone away from men.
As*p for the earth, out of it cometh bread: and under it is turned up as it were fire.
The*p stones of it are the place of sapphires: and it hath dust of gold.
There*p is a path which no fowl knoweth, and which the vulture's eye hath not seen:
The*p lion's whelps have not trodden it, nor the fierce lion passed by it.
He*p putteth forth his hand upon the rock; he overturneth the mountains by the roots.
He*p cutteth out rivers among the rocks; and his eye seeth every precious thing.
He*p bindeth the floods from overflowing; and the thing that is hid bringeth he forth to light.
But*p where shall wisdom be found? and where is the place of understanding?
Man*p knoweth not the price thereof; neither is it found in the land of the living.
The*p depth saith, It is not in me: and the sea saith, It is not with me.
It*p cannot be gotten for gold, neither shall silver be weighed for the price thereof.
It*p cannot be valued with the gold of Ophir, with the precious onyx, or the sapphire.
The*p gold and the crystal cannot equal it: and the exchange of it shall not be for jewels of fine gold.
No*p mention shall be made of coral, or of pearls: for the price of wisdom is above rubies.
The*p topaz of Ethiopia shall not equal it, neither shall it be valued with pure gold.
Whence*p then cometh wisdom? and where is the place of understanding?
Seeing*p it is hid from the eyes of all living, and kept close from the fowls of the air.
Destruction*p and death say, We have heard the fame thereof with our ears.
God*p understandeth the way thereof, and he knoweth the place thereof.
For*p he looketh to the ends of the earth, and seeth under the whole heaven;
To*p make the weight for the winds; and he weigheth the waters by measure.
When*p he made a decree for the rain, and a way for the lightning of the thunder:
Then*p did he see it, and declare it; he prepared it, yea, and searched it out.
And*p unto man he said, Behold, the fear of the Lord, that is wisdom; and to depart from evil is understanding.
